It is difficult to predict which solution will be the most effective in the long run as every measure has its own advantages and disadvantages depending on specific situations. However, it is important to note that tackling illegal wildlife trade requires a combination of various efforts, such as strengthening legal frameworks, improving enforcement, raising awareness, engaging local communities, and addressing the root causes of wildlife trafficking such as poverty and socio-economic issues. 

In terms of the innovative solutions, blockchain technology coupled with DNA analysis and smart packaging could be very promising. It has the potential to create a more transparent and secure supply chain that can track the origin and legality of wildlife products, making it more difficult for illegal trade activities to occur. Similarly, 3D printing could potentially reduce the demand for endangered species products, and synthetic/vegetarian alternatives could eventually replace some wildlife products completely, which would reduce the pressure on endangered species. Ultimately, it's important to continue exploring and testing various solutions to address the illegal wildlife trade, and to adapt to changing circumstances in order to protect endangered species in the long run.
